arabicText: ۞ قَـٰلَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكُم بِأَهْدَىٰ مِمَّا وَجَدتُّمْ عَلَيْهِ ءَابَآءَكُمْ ۖ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا بِمَآ أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِۦ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	prophet	said,	“What!	Even	if	I	bring	to	
you	a	path	better	than	what	you	found	
your	forefathers	following?”;	they	said,	
“We	do	not	believe	in	whatever	you	have	
been	sent	with.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Nabi	ne	farmāyā	aur	kyā	jab	bhi	ke	maiñ	
tumhāre	pās	woh	lāōñ	jo	sidhi	rāh	ho	us	se	
jis	par	tumhāre	bāp	dādā	they?	Bole	jo	
kuchh		tum	le	kar	bheje	gaye	ham	usey	
nahiñ	mānte

arabicText: فَٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	We	took	revenge	from	them	-	therefore	
see	what	sort	of	fate	befell	those	who	
denied!
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Ham	ne	un	se	badla	liyā	to	dekho	
jhutlāne	wāloñ	kā	kaisā	anjām	huā.

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّنِى بَرَآءٌۭ مِّمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Ibrahim	said	to	his	father	and	
his	people,	“I	have	no	relation	whatsoever	
with	your	deities.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Ibrāhim	ne	apne	bāp	aur	apni	qaum	
se	farmayā	maiñ	bezār	hooñ	tumhāre	
m'abodoñ	se

arabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِى فَطَرَنِى فَإِنَّهُۥ سَيَهْدِينِ
englishTranslationText:
“Except	Him	Who	has	created	me,	for	He	
will	soon	direct	me.”	(To	my	place	of	
migration.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Siwā	us	ke	jis	ne	mujhe	paidā	kiyā	ke	
zaroor		woh	bahut	jald	mujhe	rāh	de	gā.

arabicText: وَجَعَلَهَا كَلِمَةًۢ بَاقِيَةًۭ فِى عَقِبِهِۦ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Ibrahim	kept	this	declaration	among	
his	progeny,	in	order	that	they	may	desist.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	usey	apni	nasl	meiñ	bāqi	kalām	rakhā	
ke	kahiñ	woh	b’az	āayeñ

arabicText: بَلْ مَتَّعْتُ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ وَءَابَآءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ وَرَسُولٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
In	fact	I	gave	them	and	their	forefathers	the	
usage	of	this	world	until	the	truth	and	the	
Noble	Messenger	who	conveyed	the	
message	clearly,	came	to	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	maiñ	ne	unheñ	aur	un	ke	bāp	dādā	
ko	duniyā	ke	fāide	diye	yahāñ	tak	ke	un	ke	
pās	ḥaq	aur	sāf	batāne	wālā	Rasool	
tashreef	lāyā

arabicText: وَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌۭ وَإِنَّا بِهِۦ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	when	the	truth	came	to	them	they	said,	“This	is	magic,	and	we	disbelieve	in	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	un	ke	pās	ḥaq	āayā	bole	yeh	jādu	hai	aur	ham	is	ke	munkir	haiñ

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانُ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْقَرْيَتَيْنِ عَظِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	said,	“Why	was	the	Qur’an	not	sent	down	upon	some	chieftain	of	these	two	great	
towns?”	(The	chiefs	of	Mecca	and	Taif).
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bole	kiyuñ	na	utārā	gayā	yeh	qur’ān		in	do	shahroñ	ke	kisi	bade	āadmi	par

arabicText: أَهُمْ يَقْسِمُونَ رَحْمَتَ رَبِّكَ ۚ نَحْنُ قَسَمْنَا بَيْنَهُم مَّعِيشَتَهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ وَرَفَعْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ فَوْقَ بَعْضٍۢ دَرَجَـٰتٍۢ لِّيَتَّخِذَ بَعْضُهُم بَعْضًۭا سُخْرِيًّۭا ۗ وَرَحْمَتُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌۭ مِّمَّا يَجْمَعُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tumhāre	Rab	ki	Raḥmat	woh	bānt	te	haiñ	ham	ne	un	meiñ	un	ki	zist	(zindagi	guzārne)	kā	
sāmān	duniyā	ki	zindagi	meiñ	bāñtā	aur	un	meiñ	aik	doosre	par	darjoñ	bulandi	di	ke	un	meiñ	aik	
doosre	ki	hañsi	banāye	aur	tumhāre	Rab	ki	Raḥmat	un	ki	jam'a	jatthā	se	behtar

arabicText: وَلَوْلَآ أَن يَكُونَ ٱلنَّاسُ أُمَّةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ لَّجَعَلْنَا لِمَن يَكْفُرُ بِٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ لِبُيُوتِهِمْ سُقُفًۭا مِّن فِضَّةٍۢ وَمَعَارِجَ عَلَيْهَا يَظْهَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	were	it	not	for	that	all	people	be	on	one	religion,	We	would	have	made	for	the	disbelievers	
of	the	Most	Gracious,	roofs	and	stairs	of	silver	which	they	would	climb.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	yeh	na	hotā	ke	sab	log	aik	Deen	par	ho	jāyeñ	to	ham	zaroor	Raḥmān	ke	munkiroñ	ke	liye	
chāñdi	ki	chateñ	aur	sidhiyāñ	banāte	jin	par	chardhte.

arabicText: وَلِبُيُوتِهِمْ أَبْوَٰبًۭا وَسُرُرًا عَلَيْهَا يَتَّكِـُٔونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	doors	of	silver	for	their	houses	and	
couches	of	silver	upon	which	they	would	
recline.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	gharoñ	ke	liye	chāndi	ke	darwāze	
aur	chāndi	ke	takht	jin	par	takiya	lagāte

arabicText: وَزُخْرُفًۭا ۚ وَإِن كُلُّ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَّا مَتَـٰعُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةُ عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	diverse	adornments;	and	all	this	is	usage	
only	of	the	life	of	this	world;	and	the	
Hereafter	with	your	Lord,	is	for	the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ṭaraḥ	ṭaraḥ	ki	āarāyish	aur	yeh	jo	kuchh		
hai	jiti	duniyā	hi	kā	asbāb	hai	aur	āakhirat	
tumhāre	Rab	ke	pās	parhegāroñ	ke	liye	hai

arabicText: وَمَن يَعْشُ عَن ذِكْرِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ نُقَيِّضْ لَهُۥ شَيْطَـٰنًۭا فَهُوَ لَهُۥ قَرِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	is	averse	to	the	
Remembrance	of	the	Most	Gracious,	We	
appoint	a	devil	upon	him,	who	stays	with	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jise	rataund	(andhā	bannā)	āaye	
Raḥmān	ke	ƶikr	se	ham	us	par	aik	shaiṭān	
ta’ayyunāt	kareñ	ke	woh	us	kā	sāthi	rahe

arabicText: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَيَصُدُّونَهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	those	devils	prevent	them	
from	the	Straight	Path,	and	they	think	they	
are	on	guidance!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	woh	shayāṭeen	un	ko	rāh	se	
rokte	haiñ	aur	samajhte	yeh	haiñ	ke	woh	
rāh	par	haiñ

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَنَا قَالَ يَـٰلَيْتَ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَكَ بُعْدَ ٱلْمَشْرِقَيْنِ فَبِئْسَ ٱلْقَرِينُ
englishTranslationText:
To	the	extent	that	when	the	disbeliever	
will	be	brought	to	Us,	he	will	say	to	his	
devil,	“Alas	-	if	only	there	was	the	distance*	
of	east	and	west,	between	you	and	me!”	-	
so	what	an	evil	companion**	he	is!	(*	Had	I	
not	listened	to	you.	**They	will	be	bound	
together	in	chains.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahāñ	tak	ke	jab	kāfir	hamāre	pās	āaye	gā	
apne	shaiṭān	se	kahe	gā	hāye	kisi	ṭaraḥ	
mujh	se	tujh	meiñ	poorab	pachchim	
(mashriq-o-maghrib)	kā	fāsila	hotā	to	kiyā	
hi	burā	sāthi	hai.

arabicText: وَلَن يَنفَعَكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ إِذ ظَّلَمْتُمْ أَنَّكُمْ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ مُشْتَرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
(It will be said to them)	“And	you	will	not	
benefit	from	them	this	day,	whereas	you	
are	unjust	-	for	you	are	all	partners	in	the	
punishment.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hargiz	tumhārā	is	se	bhalā	na	hogā	āaj	
jab	ke	tum	ne	zulm	kiyā	ke	tum	sab	'aƶāb	
meiñ	sharik	ho

arabicText: أَفَأَنتَ تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ أَوْ تَهْدِى ٱلْعُمْىَ وَمَن كَانَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	will	you	make	the	deaf	listen	or	show	the	
path	to	the	blind,	and	to	those	who	are	in	
open	error?	(The disbelievers whose hearts 
are sealed, are deaf and blind to the truth).
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kiyā	tum	bahroñ	ko	sunāō	ge	yā	andhoñ	
ko	rāh	dikhāō	ge	aur	unheñ	jo	khuli	
gumrāhi	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: فَإِمَّا نَذْهَبَنَّ بِكَ فَإِنَّا مِنْهُم مُّنتَقِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	if	We	take	you	away,	We	shall	then	
indeed	take	revenge	from	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	agar	ham	tumheñ	le	jāyeñ	to	un	se	ham	
zaroor		badla	leñ	ge.

arabicText: أَوْ نُرِيَنَّكَ ٱلَّذِى وَعَدْنَـٰهُمْ فَإِنَّا عَلَيْهِم مُّقْتَدِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: Or	show	you	what	We	have	promised	them	-	We	therefore	have	complete	control	over	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	tumheñ	dikhā	deñ	jis	kā	unheñ	ham	ne	w'ada	diyā	hai	to	ham	un	par	badi	qudrat	wāle	haiñ.

arabicText: فَٱسْتَمْسِكْ بِٱلَّذِىٓ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	hold	fast	to	what	We	have	divinely	revealed	to	you;	indeed	you	are	upon	the	Straight	
Path.	(The	Holy	Prophets	can	never	go	astray).
romanUrduTranslationText: To	mazbooṭ	thāme	raho	usey	jo	tumhāri	ṭaraf	waḥi	ki	gayi	be-shak	tum	seedhi	rāh	per	ho

arabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَذِكْرٌۭ لَّكَ وَلِقَوْمِكَ ۖ وَسَوْفَ تُسْـَٔلُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	it	is	undoubtedly	an	honour	for	you	and	your	people;	and	you	will	soon	be	questioned.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	woh	sharaf	hai	tumhāre	liye	aur	tumhāri	qaum	ke	liye	aur	'anqarib	tum	se	poochā	jāye	
gā

arabicText: وَسْـَٔلْ مَنْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رُّسُلِنَآ أَجَعَلْنَا مِن دُونِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ءَالِهَةًۭ يُعْبَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	ask	them	-	did	any	of	the	Noble	Messengers	We	sent	before	you,	appoint	any	other	Gods	
except	the	Most	Gracious,	whom	they	used	to	worship?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	se	pocho	jo	ham	ne	tum	se	pahle	Rasool	bheje	kiyā	ham	ne	Raḥmāṇ	ke	siwā	kuch		aur	khudā	
thahrāye	jin	ko	poojā	ho

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦ فَقَالَ إِنِّى رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	sent	Moosa	along	with	Our	signs	towards	Firaun	and	his	chieftains	-	he	therefore	
said,	“Indeed	I	am	a	Noble	Messenger	of	the	Lord	of	the	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Mūsā	ko	apni	nishāniyoñ	ke	sāth	fir'aun	aur	us	ke	sardāroñ	ki	ṭaraf	bhejā	to	us	
ne	farmāyā	be-shak	maiñ	us	kā	Rasool	huñ	jo	sāre	jahāñ	kā	mālik	hai

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِذَا هُم مِّنْهَا يَضْحَكُونَ
englishTranslationText: So	when	he	brought	Our	signs	to	them,	they	started	mocking	at	them!
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jab	woh	un	ke	pās	hamāri	nishāniyāñ	lāyā	jabhi	woh	un	par	hañsne	lage

arabicText: وَمَا نُرِيهِم مِّنْ ءَايَةٍ إِلَّا هِىَ أَكْبَرُ مِنْ أُخْتِهَا ۖ وَأَخَذْنَـٰهُم بِٱلْعَذَابِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	all	the	signs	We	showed	them	were	
always	greater	than	the	earlier	ones;	and	
We	seized	them	with	calamities,	so	that	
they	may	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	unheñ	jo	nishāni	dikhāte	woh	pahle	se	badi	hoti	aur	Ham	ne	unheñ	musibat	meiñ	giriftār	
kiyā	ke	woh	bāz	āayeñ

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَ ٱلسَّاحِرُ ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ بِمَا عَهِدَ عِندَكَ إِنَّنَا لَمُهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	said,	“O	you	magician!	Pray	for	us	
to	your	Lord,	by	the	means	of	His	covenant	
which	is	with	you;	we	will	certainly	come	
to	guidance.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	ke	aey	jādugar	Hamāre	liye	apne	
Rab	se	du'ā	kar	us	'ahad	ke	sabab	jo	us	kā	
tere	pās	hai	be-shak	ham	hidāyat	par	
āayeñ	ge
